FuncDef: The display isis peer command displays IS-IS neighbor information.
CLIs: display isis peer [ verbose ] [ [ <process-id> | { vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> } ] | [ interface { <interface-name> | <interfacetype> <interfacenumber> } ] ] [ peer-system-id <peer-system-id-value> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Displays detailed information about an IS-IS neighbor, including its area address, duration during which the neighbor stays Up, and IP address of its directly connected interface.
-

Displays neighbor information about the specified IS-IS process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.
By default, information about all IS-IS neighbors in all IS-IS processes is displayed.

Displays neighbor information about a specified VPN instance to which an IS-IS process belongs.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported. In addition, the VPN instance name must not be _public_. When double quotation marks are used around the string, spaces are allowed in the string.

Specifies the type and number of an interface.
-

Displays information about the neighbor with a specified system ID.
-

Examples: System Id        Interface        Circuit Id          State HoldTime Type      PRI
System Id       Interface         Circuit Id           State  HoldTime   Type       PRI
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In an IS-IS area, if you need to check whether two devices can communicate with each other, run the display isis peer command to view information about the neighbor, such as its status, duration during which the neighbor stays Up, and the neighbor type. If an IS-IS neighbor relationship fails to be established, check whether interfaces are Up, a system ID conflict occurs, the local and remote IP addresses are in the same network segment, or area addresses of the two ends between which a Level-1 neighbor relationship is to be established are the same.
